title: Fifty Labour MPs sign letter objecting to Andy Burnham decision
description: Labour's ruling National Executive Committee blocked the Greater Manchester mayor from standing in a by-election.
content:
Around 50 Labour MPs have signed a letter objecting to the decision to block Greater Manchester Mayor Andy Burnham from standing in a forthcoming parliamentary by-election, BBC News understands.
They have written to Sir Keir Starmer to warn the decis... [793 chars]

title: Can India be a player in the computer chip industry?
description: India is investing hundreds of millions of dollars in building up a computer chip industry.
content:
A reliable supply of computer chips is essential for Arnob Roy, the co-founder of Tejas Networks.
His company, based in Bangalore, India, supplies the equipment behind mobile phone networks and broadband connections.

title: Landmark social media trial to begin over addiction claims
description: Defendants include Meta, which owns Instagram and Facebook, TikTok's owner ByteDance and YouTube parent Google.
content:
A landmark social media addiction trial in which top tech executives are expected to testify begins on Tuesday in California.
The plaintiff, a 19-year-old woman identified by the initials KGM, alleges the design of the platforms' algorithms left her ... [3850 chars]

title: Graduated driver licensing: Northern Ireland to bring in changes for young drivers
description: The new rules will be introduced in October and are described as the most significant reform of driver licensing for 70 years.
content:
Northern Ireland will become the first area of the UK to bring in graduated driver licensing for learner drivers in a bid to reduce the amount of fatal road crashes involving young people, it has been announced.
The reforms, described as the most sig... [4704 chars]

title: Thierno Barry makes profligate Leeds pay to earn Everton a point
description: Thierno Barry secured a point for Everton in their 1-1 draw against Leeds at Hill Dickinson Stadium
content:
Thierno Barry’s debut season in English football must have tested the patience of David Moyes at times but the Everton manager’s perseverance is being rewarded.
